title: NumPy: Matrix Transpose
story: Transposing flips a matrix over its diagonal - rows become columns and vice versa. Critical for linear algebra operations.
instructions: Create a 2x3 matrix [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]. Transpose it to get a 3x2 matrix and print the result.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Transpose matrix
matrix = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
transposed = matrix.T
print(transposed)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

matrix = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
transposed = matrix.T
print(transposed)

tests.expectedBehavior: Transpose to swap rows and columns

hints.text: Use .T attribute or np.transpose() to transpose a matrix.
